intro: Vernonia liatroides, commonly known as the silverleaf ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and conical flower heads that bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its medicinal properties. Vernonia liatroides typically grows in dry, open habitats such as woodlands and prairies. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their astringent and anti-inflammatory effects.
